main event: Crew members of the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt observed a round glowing object traveling at high speed on September 30, 1952.
interesting points: The object was reported to be about 20 to 25 feet in diameter and luminous in appearance., The object crossed the bow of the ship, passed over the aft part, and disappeared in about 12 seconds., The sighting was made by experienced aviation personnel who were considered reliable., There were no sounds detected during the sighting., This is part of a larger investigation by Project Blue Book into unidentified aerial phenomena.
witness description: crew members on the U.S.S. Franklin D. Roosevelt
